entry.title: Vatican synod ends without clear stances on women, LGBT community
entry.summary: The month-long Vatican meeting on the future of the Roman Catholic Church ended without clear positions on issues such as women deacons and LGBT inclusion. The meeting, called a Synod of Bishops, allowed women and lay people to vote on Church affairs for the first time. However, the final report did not take a stand on LGBT issues despite discussions beforehand. The report mentioned the need to hear and accompany marginalized individuals but did not call for greater inclusion. LGBT advocates expressed disappointment with the report. The pope will close the gathering with a Mass on Sunday.

entry.title: Hamas militants holed up in 'Metro' web of tunnels pose challenge
entry.summary: The extensive tunnel network built by the Hamas militant group in the Gaza Strip poses a significant threat to Israeli troops and the Palestinian population. Clearing and collapsing these tunnels is crucial for dismantling Hamas, but it is a challenging task that strips the Israeli military of its technological advantages. The tunnels provide Hamas with hiding places and the ability to choose the time and location of engagement. Israeli airstrikes have targeted these tunnels, but combating underground warfare is difficult due to the abundance of ambush opportunities.

entry.title: Is The US Military â€˜Laying The Groundworkâ€™ To Reinstitute the Draft? The Pentagon Says No
entry.summary:
AI imagines what would happen if Biden declares and activates the Selective Service Act and begins drafting 20 years old to war pic.twitter.com/896Htrtteu â€” The Post Millennial (@TPostMillennial) February 27, 2023
Military Times/AP: No, the US military isnâ€™t â€˜laying the groundworkâ€™ for a draft
Â Claim: The U.S. military is planning to reinstitute the draft.
Â APâ€™s Assessment: False. Defense officials confirm the armed forces have made no such recommendation to Congress or the president, which are the entities empowered to authorize a draft.
Â The Facts: With Americaâ€™s allies in Europe and the Middle East embroiled in conflicts with no end in sight, social media posts are claiming the U.S. military is considering mandating regular citizens to enlist in the armed forces.Â A number of those are sharing a headline from a Sept. 25 article from the Mises Institute, a libertarian group in Alabama that reads: â€œThe US Military Is Laying the Groundwork to Reinstitute the Draft.â€
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: "U.S. military draft" has been trending on search engines for the past few weeks. Videos like the one above and rumors on social media are probably fueling it .... Video of Biden calling for a military draft is AI-generated, not real | Fact check (USA Today). More here .... Fighting 'Joe Biden's wars': False rumor of 'draft' spreads across social media as 'medicated' Gen Z slammed for not signing up (Meaww), and here .... Fact Check: Video of Joe Biden calling for a military draft was created with AI (Reuters). Just one more note.Â On the eve of Russia's invasion of Ukraine the Kyiv government was telling everyone to not worry, and to stay home. Within 24 hours of Russia's invasion, the Ukraine government immediately closed its border to men of military age who can be drafted. The U.S. government will do the same. Telling everyone that everything is fine, until the very moment that the "shit hits the fan".

entry.title: Mass graves & a city robbed of funeral rites
entry.summary: The ongoing conflict in Gaza has not only resulted in the loss of lives but has also disrupted the funeral rites of Palestinians, depriving them of dignity and closure. The high number of casualties has overwhelmed hospitals and morgues, making it difficult to perform traditional funeral rituals. Many bodies are unrecognizable due to decomposition or the absence of surviving family members. In an attempt to increase the chances of identification, families are resorting to wearing identification bracelets and writing names on their children's bodies.

Card had not been involuntarily committed to a mental health facility, and a simple evaluation or voluntary commitment would not have prohibited him from owning a gun.

entry.title: New Image Reveals B-21 Raider Taxiing Ahead Of Its First Scheduled Flight
entry.summary: Warzone: B-21 Raider Has Begun Taxi TestsÂ The Air Force is hopeful that the B-21 Raider stealth bomber will take to the skies for the first time before the end of the year.Â The U.S. Air Force's first pre-production B-21 Raider stealth bomber is now undergoing taxi testing, moving around the sprawling Plant 42 in Palmdale under its own power. This is the latest developmental milestone for the aircraft as it continues to move closer to its first flight, which could come before the end of the year.Â "I can confirm the B-21 is conducting ground taxi activities. Rigorous testing is a critical step in the B-21 flight test program," an Air Force spokesperson confirmed to The War Zone today. "Extensive testing evaluates systems, components, and functionalities. This testing allows us to mitigate risks, optimize design, and enhance operational effectiveness."Â Read more ....Â Â WNU Editor: The first contracts for production of the B-21 are being drawn up .... Northrop expects B-21 low-rate production contract by year-end (Flight Global).Â Â New Image Reveals B-21 Raider Taxiing Ahead Of Its First Scheduled FlightÂ New Image of B-21 Bomber Tail Shows Different Exhausts and Rear Deck from B-2 -- Air And Space Forces MagazineÂ B-21 Raider begins taxi tests, a key step before first flight -- Defense NewsÂ B-21 starts taxi tests; Northrop expects first flight by year's end -- Defense OneÂ New Image Reveals B-21 Raider Taxiing Ahead Of Maiden Flight -- Zero HedgeÂ B-21 Raider: US Stealth Bomber Commences Taxi Testing Ahead Of Its First Scheduled Flight -- EurAsian Times

entry.title: UNÂ agency 'immensely worried' after losing contact to staff in Gaza
entry.summary: The United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) has lost contact with its staff in Gaza amid the Israeli bombardment of the coastal strip. UNRWA Commissioner General Philippe Lazzarini said he had lost contact with the "vast majority" of his team. "This makes me immensely worried for colleagues and their families." He said he sincerely hoped his message would reach staff. Lazzarini described the communications blackout as "yet another action taken to try to impede the humanitarian response to the civilians of the Gaza Strip."

"As part of the operation, IDF soldiers identified terrorist cells attempting to launch anti-tank missiles and mortar shells and struck them. IDF soldiers also identified and destroyed a booby-trapped structure," it said.

entry.summary: Over 20,000 people marched through Johannesburg in support of LGBTQ+ communities in Africa who face criminalization and cannot openly express their identities. The parade was led by a Ugandan man who had fled his country after being arrested for being gay. The march aimed to raise awareness for LGBT rights in Africa, particularly in Uganda, where the death penalty for homosexuality was introduced in May. South Africa, in contrast, legalized same-sex marriage in 2006 and is the only African country to have done so.

entry.title: US Halts Most Civilian Firearm And Ammunition Exports For 90 Days
entry.summary:
WikipediaÂ
Reuters: US halts exports of most civilian firearms for 90 daysÂ WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The U.S. has stopped issuing export licenses for most civilian firearms and ammunition for 90 days for all non-governmental users, the Commerce Department said on Friday, citing national security and foreign policy interests.Â The Commerce Department did not provide further details for the pause, which also includes shotguns and optical sights, but said an urgent review will assess the "risk of firearms being diverted to entities or activities that promote regional instability, violate human rights, or fuel criminal activities."
Â Read more ....
Â WNU editor: This is unprecedented. The only exceptions to this export ban are Israel and Ukraine.Â So why the ban and this hoarding of weapons and ammo?Â My gut tells me that with US military stockpiles now at an all time low and supply chain disruptions areÂ growing. In this environment the US has made the decision that with international relations deteriorating and threats of a major war growing everyday, the US needs to replenish some of their stockpiles ASAP.

entry.title: South Koreans hold subdued Halloween celebrations a year after party crush killed 159
entry.summary: Halloween celebrations in South Korea were subdued on the eve of the first anniversary of the harrowing party crush that killed 159 people. Many restaurants, bars, department stores and amusement parks are avoiding Halloween-themed events as a sign of respect for the victims. Few people clad in Halloween costumes were seen Saturday in Seoulâ€™s popular Itaewon neighbourhood, the site of last yearâ€™s deadly surge when many revellers and others packed an alley, causing people to fall on each other like dominoes. The walls of the narrow, sloped alley in Itaewon were plastered with numerous Post-it notes with condolence messages that read â€œWe wonâ€™t forget youâ€ and â€œWeâ€™ll remember youâ€. A mourning station established in central Seoul received many visitors, who laid white flowers and burned incense in front of photos of the victims. In Seoulâ€™s Hongdae area, another entertainment zone, there were only a few people wearing Halloween outfits. Authorities have deployed thousands of police, emergency and other officials since Friday for crowd control and safety of pedestrians in Itaewon and 15 other major nightlife districts in Seoul. About 200 police officers were separately mobilised to monitor narcotics use and violent crime, according to Seoul police. â€œI offer a deep apology again by bearing the sorrow and heavy responsibility for the disaster in my heart,â€ Seoul Mayor Oh Se-hoon said on Friday. â€œThe way to overcome the pains and sorrow of the disaster is preventing this kind of incident from happening again.â€ Bereaved families are to hold a formal memorial service on Sunday. In January, a police special investigation team concluded that police and municipal officials failed to work out effective crowd control steps despite correctly anticipating a huge number of people in Itaewon. Investigators also concluded that police had ignored hotline calls by pedestrians who warned of swelling crowds before the surge turned deadly. The Itaewon crush caused a nationwide outpouring of grief as the dead were mostly in their 20sâ€¦

entry.title: Mauritius Begins to Correct a Historic Wrong Towards LGBTQI+ People
entry.summary:
MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct 27 (IPS) - In response to lawsuits brought by LGBTQI+ activists, the Mauritius Supreme Court has issued two landmark judgments striking down the criminalisation of consensual sex between adult men as unconstitutional. Its reasoning turned upside down the argument used by anti-rights forces to attack LGBTQI+ activists in many African countries: it acknowledged that criminalisation is the foreign import rather than gay sex, and a relic of colonialism itâ€™s high time to shake off.

Read the full story, â€œMauritius Begins to Correct a Historic Wrong Towards LGBTQI+ Peopleâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: Dozens of elephants mysteriously dropped dead in Zimbabwe. Now, researchers know why.
entry.summary: Several years ago, dozens of elephants mysteriously dropped dead in Zimbabwe, a landlocked country in southern Africa. Now, researchers finally know why. Over several months of 2020, 35 African elephant carcasses were discovered in the Kavangoâ€“Zambezi conservation area, which encompasses five countries and is home to Africaâ€™s largest population of elephants. Intriguingly, the carcasses showed no signs of outward trauma or distress; their skin was bite-free, and their tusks were intact, which ruled out predators and poachers as the cause of death.

The foundation cited financial concerns, including soaring construction costs and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. However, the city of Orlando is still moving forward with constructing a memorial for the victims. The efforts to build a memorial and museum have been slow, with the nightclub's owners only recently agreeing to sell the property.

entry.title: Super Mafia: Rising concerns as Italy's top three gang godfathers seen sharing meal
entry.summary: Italian authorities have captured footage of the leaders of Italy's three most powerful organized crime groups - the Ndrangheta, Camorra, and Cosa Nostra - sharing a meal, raising concerns of a potential alliance. Prosecutors believe that these once-rival criminal organizations have set aside their differences to form a grand alliance, exploiting business opportunities in Italy's prosperous north. The mafia groups have shifted their focus to white-collar crime and legitimate investments, funneling drug trafficking profits into various sectors.

entry.title: Are Gaza's Casualty Numbers Accurate?
entry.summary:
Time: Biden Cast Doubt on Gazaâ€™s Death Toll. Palestinian Officials Responded With 6,747 NamesÂ In the past three weeks, more than 1,400 people in Israel and 7,000 Palestinians have been killed amid fighting between Israel and Hamas. That is, if you believe the casualty figures coming out of the region. This week, U.S. President Joe Biden suggested that the Palestinian death toll in Gaza, which has been under heavy bombardment by Israel following Hamasâ€™ Oct. 7 massacre, is not to be trusted.Â â€œIâ€™m sure innocents have been killed, and itâ€™s a price of waging a war,â€ Biden said at a press conference on Wednesday. â€œBut I have no confidence in the number that the Palestinians are using.â€ The President didnâ€™t offer further evidence for his skepticism of the Palestinian health ministry's data, which the U.S. State Department has cited both internally and publicly, in the latter case as recently as March. (When asked to provide evidence to support Biden's statement, the White House referred TIME to comments made by U.S. National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby, who on Thursday reiterated the Presidentâ€™s assertion that the death toll cannot be taken â€œat face valueâ€ because the â€œGaza Ministry of Health is just a front for Hamas.â€)

entry.title: Spanish clergy sexually abused over 2,00,000 children, probe estimates
entry.summary: An independent commission in Spain has estimated that over 200,000 minors have been sexually abused by the Roman Catholic clergy since 1940. The report, which surveyed over 8,000 people, found that 0.6% of Spain's adult population said they had suffered sexual abuse by members of the clergy as children. Including abuse by lay members, the percentage rises to 1.13%. The commission also interviewed 487 victims who highlighted the lasting emotional impact of the abuse. The report criticizes the Catholic Church's response, calling for the creation of a state fund to compensate victims.

This incident echoed a similar incident involving former chief of Muttahida Qaumi Movement, Altaf Hussain. Sharif's remarks were seen as sexist and misogynistic, with critics highlighting his belief that only his daughter, Maryam, should be involved in politics.

Syrian opposition activists confirmed the strikes, and casualties are yet to be determined. Iran-backed groups have retaliated with rocket attacks on a US base in Syria and an attempted drone attack on an airbase in Iraq.

The Israel Defense Forcesâ€™ relatively small size in relation to the population density and urban sprawl of Gaza will strip away many of the Israeli militaryâ€™s inherent asymmetries. entry.title: Donald Trump files 'interesting' classified docs motion in D.C. elections case
entry.summary: Former President Donald Trump filed a new motion in the federal 2020 election interference case, hinting that he plans to adopt a new defense. Specifically, he wants to introduce supposed classified reports of foreign interference that support the merits of his efforts to overturn the election. "The Indictment in this case adopts classified assessments by the Intelligence Community and others that minimized, and at times ignored, efforts by foreign actors to influence and interfere with the 2020 election," said the filing. "President Trump will offer classified information at trial relating to foreign influence activities that impacted the 2016 and 2020 elections, as well as efforts by his administration to combat those activities. President Trump will also present classified information relating to the biased and politicized nature of the intelligence assessments that he and others rejected during the events in question. Collectively, this evidence will undercut central theories of the prosecution and establish that President Trump acted at all times in good faith and on the belief that he was doing what he had been elected to do." POLL: Should Trump be allowed to run for office? "Mostly appears to be IC assessments of foreign interference," said legal analyst Bradley Moss in response to the new filing, in a post on X. "This should be interesting." It is unclear why Trump would put this evidence forward, as commentators have noted that Trump trying to actually prove his long-discredited claims of voter fraud and election rigging would not be relevant to the crimes of which he is accused. He is more broadly expected to mount an advice of counsel defense, although special counsel Jack Smith has long been laying the groundwork to destroy such a legal strategy. Ironically, the other federal case against Trump that Smith is pursuing pertains to his alleged illegal theft and retention of classified information in unsecured boxes at his Mar-a-Lago country club in South Florida.

entry.title: U.S. Sending More Military Aid To Ukraine
entry.summary:
Ukrainian servicemen prepare to fire at Russian positions from a U.S.-supplied M777 howitzer in Kharkiv, Ukraine, on July 14, 2022. VOA has learned the U.S. will provide up to $150 million in additional military aid for Ukraine as soon as Oct. 25, 2023.Â
VOA: Exclusive: $150 Million in Ukraine Military Aid Expected WednesdayÂ PENTAGON â€” The United States is providing up to $150 million in additional military aid for Ukraine in a package expected as soon as Wednesday, three U.S. military officials tell VOA, a week after Ukraine used its newest weapon from the United States to pummel Russian military targets deep into Russian-controlled eastern Ukraine.Â The package includes more GMLRS rockets for High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS), munitions for the National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile System (NASAMS), TOW anti-tank missiles, AIM-9 Sidewinder missiles and 155 mm rounds, according to two of the officials who spoke to VOA on condition of anonymity to discuss the package prior to its announcement.
Â Read more ....
Â Update #1: US to supply Ukraine with new $150 million military aid package (Ukrainska Pravda)Â Update #2: US Announces New $150Mln Military Package for Ukraine, Including NASAMS, AIM-9M, Stinger Missiles (Sputnik)
Â WNU Editor: I am not surprised that the U.S. is sending more military aid to Ukraine. I am surprised that it is only $150 million.

Reuters: 900 US troops heading to Middle East to bolster defenses as attacks surgeÂ WASHINGTON (Reuters) - About 900 more U.S. troops have arrived in the Middle East or are heading there to bolster air defenses for U.S. personnel amid a surge in attacks by Iran-affiliated groups, the Pentagon said on Thursday. As tensions soar over the Israel-Hamas war, U.S. and coalition troops have been attacked at least 12 times in Iraq and four times in Syria in the last week, Pentagon spokesperson Brigadier General Patrick Ryder told reporters.Â A total of 21 U.S. forces have suffered minor injuries, the vast majority of them traumatic brain injuries.
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: One source that I trust is saying that two more US aircraft carrier strike groups are going to be deployed to the Middle East in the coming days. This will make a total of 4 US aircraft carrier strike groups being deployed to the Middle East.
If true, this is not a deployment to deter other actors to get involved in the Israel - Hamas war, this is a deployment to strike a major target.

entry.title: France Deploys One LHD And Two Frigates To The Eastern Mediterranean
entry.summary:
The Tonnerre ship can carry helicopters, armored vehicles, tanks and troops | Laura Kayali/POLITICO
Â
Politico: The EU prepares for war â€” and this French ship is the tip of the spearÂ Franceâ€™s powerful amphibious helicopter carrier is a floating village with gyms and a boulangerie â€¦ plus missiles, machine guns, landing craft, choppers and tanks.Â ABOARD THE FRENCH HELICOPTER CARRIER TONNERRE â€” John Denverâ€™s "Country Roads," a folk song from 1971, resounds through the Tonnerre.Â Itâ€™s 7:30 a.m., and some of the crew aboard the Mistral-class amphibious helicopter carrier are already eating breakfast â€” loading up on coffee, bread and jam ahead of a planned exercise to storm a Spanish beach. It's been a short night, and plans for the landing have changed several times.Â The French assault vessel â€” 199 meters long, 32 meters wide and able to carry 21,500 metric tons â€” is a key element in the European Unionâ€™s first live military exercise in October off the southern coast of Spain.Â Â Read more ....Â Â France Deploys One LHD And Two Frigates To The Eastern MediterraneanÂ France Deploys One LHD, Two Frigates to the Eastern Mediterranean -- Naval News Â France sends Mistral-class amphibious assault ship Tonnerre to help Gaza -- Navy Recognition Â French Tonnerre: Why Macron is sending the ship to Gaza -- BBC

entry.title: Blake Masters abandons Arizona Senate race â€” and lets Kari Lake have GOP nomination
entry.summary: Blake Masters has dropped out of the U.S. Senate race, announcing Thursday that he is running for Congress instead. It paves the way for failed gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake to take the Republican nomination. Masters, who failed in his attempt at a U.S. Senate seat in 2022 against Sen. Mark Kelly (D-AZ), announced his new campaign on social media, saying that he's seeking the eighth congressional district. "Biden has failed. We need Trump back. We need to stop inflation, Build the Wall, avoid WW3, and secure Arizona's water future," the candidate said. "We need to fight for our families." POLL: Should Trump be allowed to run for office? The district, which includes part of Peoria and north Glendale, is currently held by Rep. Debbie Lesko (R), who assumed office in May, 2018. Lesko announced that she was retiring earlier in 2023 and there are now 13 candidates running for the seat. Masters was supported and funded for his Senate run by billionaire investor Peter Thiel, who pledged $5 million on the race but ultimately spent $15 million.

The use of AI in music remains a subject of industry-wide debate.

entry.title: A Look At Hamas's Underground Tunnel System
entry.summary:
Daily Mail: Inside Hamas's underground city: Footage shows how the terrorists excavate tunnels, use them to move weapons, carry out attacks on Israel and smuggle prisoners back to GazaÂ * Footage shows the elaborate tunnels Palestinian Islamist fighters are usingÂ * Heavily armed militants can be seen navigating the tunnelsÂ * Missiles, machine guns, ammunition and rocket propelled weapons are visibleÂ Chilling footage has emerged showing the elaborate tunnel systems that Hamas terrorists have been using to move weapons, hostages and stage attacks on Israel.Â The footage gives insight into the claustrophobic conditions the Palestinian Islamist fighters have been operating in.
It shows militants using metal rods and shovels to dig the tunnels.Â Many of them appear to be quite cramped and dark with footage showing the fighters slightly slouching as they move through the tunnels guided by headtorches.
Â Read more ....
Â WNU Editor: There is some speculation that Israel will use this "new bomb" to destroy this tunnel system .... 'Sponge bombs' are Israel's new secret weapon to block Hamas tunnels (The Telegraph). But if the situation gets drastic, there are concerns that this may happen .... Israel-Palestine war: Israel plans to flood Hamas tunnels with nerve gas, source says (Middle East Eye). More here .... Will Israel Use Nerve Gas Against Hamas? What We Know, What We Don't (Newsweek).Â A Look At Hamas's Underground Tunnel System

entry.title: 'Time bomb': Tree-killing bugs threaten France's lush forests
entry.summary: France is facing an ecological challenge as bark beetles invade the forest of La Teste-de-Buch, which was previously damaged by wildfires. The beetles infest weakened pine trees, laying their eggs in the bark and causing the trees to die. Efforts to combat the infestation include tree removal, but experts warn that if nothing is done, the situation will worsen in the future. The beetle infestation has even spread to urban areas, requiring the removal of pine trees from residents' gardens.

He warned that if there are voting irregularities, the entire election process could be suspended and new elections organized. Tensions have been escalating in the capital city of Dhaka, with simultaneous rallies announced by the ruling and opposition parties. Major Western nations, including the United States, have called for fair and credible polls in Bangladesh.

entry.title: Hurricane Otis leaves at least 27 dead in Mexico's Acapulco
entry.summary: Hurricane Otis hit Mexico's beach resort city of Acapulco as a category 5 storm, causing at least 27 deaths and leaving the city in a state of disaster. The storm brought winds of 165 miles per hour, cutting off communications and road links with the region. President Lopez Obrador had to abandon his vehicle and walk to the scene due to blocked roads. Residents described the destruction of buildings, looting, and the struggle to find food and shelter.

entry.title: City did not deserve this terrible assault on its citizens: Governor on Maine mass shooting
entry.summary: Governor of Maine, Janet Mills, expressed her condolences after a tragic mass shooting in Lewiston, stating that no city or state deserves such violence. The shooting took place at a bar and bowling alley, resulting in at least 18 deaths and 13 injuries. The primary suspect, Robert Card, is still at large, prompting a massive search. Schools were canceled, and residents were advised to stay indoors. President Joe Biden ordered flags to be lowered to half-staff as a mark of respect for the victims.

entry.title: Ukraine says its Black Sea grain corridor is working
entry.summary: The Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister, Oleksandr Kubrakov, has denied reports that the new Black Sea export corridor has been suspended. Ukrainian and British firms had reported that Ukraine had suspended use of the corridor due to a possible threat from Russian warplanes and sea mines. However, Kubrakov stated that all available routes established by the Ukrainian Navy are valid and being used by civilian vessels. The corridor was launched in August as a "humanitarian corridor" to bypass the de facto blockade in the Black Sea after Russia quit a U.N.-brokered deal.

entry.title: Russia formally charges detained US-Russian journalist
entry.summary: A US-Russian journalist, Alsu Kurmasheva, has been charged by Russia for failing to register as a "foreign agent." This move by Russian authorities has been criticized by rights groups as an escalation of their campaign against independent media. Kurmasheva is the second US reporter to be detained in Russia this year. If convicted, she could face up to five years in prison. Critics argue that the law is overly broad, allowing Russian law enforcement to arrest journalists at will.

entry.title: Arab countries condemn 'flagrant violations' in targeting civilians in Gaza
entry.summary: Arab countries including the United Arab Emirates, Jordan, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, Oman, Qatar, Kuwait, Egypt, and Morocco have condemned Israel's targeting of civilians and violations of international law in Gaza. They argue that Israel's right to self-defense does not justify neglecting the rights of Palestinians. The ministers also criticized forced displacement and collective punishment in Gaza, emphasizing the need for a two-state solution with an independent Palestinian state. Both the West Bank and East Jerusalem, captured by Israel in 1967, should be part of this solution.

entry.title: Qatar Sentences 8 Indians To Death On Spying For Israel
entry.summary:
Al Arabiya/Reuters: Qatar court announces death penalty verdict for eight Indians over spying charges
Â New Delhi said in a statement that it attaches â€œhigh importance to this caseâ€ and will â€œtake up the verdict with Qatari authorities.â€ Â A Qatar court has announced the death penalty for eight Indians arrested in the country last year, the Indian government said on Thursday, adding it was â€œdeeply shockedâ€ by the verdict.Â New Delhi said in a statement that it attaches â€œhigh importance to this caseâ€ and will â€œtake up the verdict with Qatari authorities.â€Â Local media has reported that the eight men, who worked with a private company in Qatar, were arrested for spying in August 2022, but Reuters could not independently confirm the charges.

entry.title: 'Unfit to hold office': Marjorie Taylor Greene tries to censure Dem for 'insurrection'
entry.summary: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) offered a resolution on Thursday to censure Rep. Rashida Tlaib (R-MI) for what she said was an "insurrection." Greene brought the resolution to the House floor after Tlaib participated in a peaceful protest at the Capitol to call for a ceasefire in Gaza. "A resolution censuring Representative Rashida Tlaib for anti-Semitic activity, sympathizing with terrorist organizations, and leading an insurrection at the United States Capitol Complex," Greene said, reading her resolution. "Whereas by leading an anti-American and anti-Semitic insurrection on October 18, 2023, Rashida Tlaib followed Hezbollah's orders to carry out a day of unprecedented anger, following an explosion at a Gazan hospital, lying about Israel's responsibility for the attack, which United States intelligence agencies said was not perpetrated by Israel." POLL: Should Trump be allowed to hold office again? "And whereas members of Congress who denounce the United States while praising terrorist organizations are unfit to hold office," she continued. "Now, therefore, be it resolved that Representative Rashida Tlaib be censured." The chair ruled that the full House would consider Greene's resolution at a later date. Watch the video below.

entry.title: Maria Corina Machado is winner of Venezuela opposition primary that government has denounced
entry.summary: Maria Corina Machado has been declared the winner of an opposition-organized primary in Venezuela to choose a presidential candidate. The voting, which drew over 2.4 million voters, was denounced by the government as illegitimate. Despite government doubts and a ban on Machado running for office, the opposition commission declared her the winner with 93% support. Voters expressed their hopes for a change in government to address the country's complex crisis.

entry.title: Human Action Pushing the World Closer to Environmental Tipping Points, UN University Warns
entry.summary:
SAINT LUCIA, Oct 26 (IPS) - A new report by the University lists six areas of grave concern and states that in the absence of behavior and priority change, the world could face catastrophe in areas like groundwater depletion and species extinction.Melting mountain glaciers. Unbearable heat. An uninsurable future. Space debris. Groundwater depletion. Accelerating extinctions. The United Nations University Institute for Environment and Human Security said this week that these six environmental "tipping points" can have "irreversible, catastrophic impacts for people and the planet."

Read the full story, â€œHuman Action Pushing the World Closer to Environmental Tipping Points, UN University Warnsâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi Is In Washington For High-Level Meetings
entry.summary:
VOA: China's Top Diplomat Arrives in Washington for Talks Ahead of Potential Biden-Xi MeetingÂ State Department â€” Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi arrived in Washington Thursday for meetings with senior U.S. officials on bilateral and regional security issues as the two countries aim to maintain open communication channels.Â Â U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is hosting Wang at the State Department for a working dinner after meetings in the late afternoon. White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan is holding talks with him at Blair House, near the White House, Friday. Read more ....
Â Update #1: Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi in Washington for high-level meetings -- Washington PostÂ Update #2: As world roils, US and China seek to ease strained ties and prepare for possible Biden-Xi summit -- APÂ WNU Editor: US President Biden will be talking with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi tomorrow .... Exclusive: Biden set to speak with China's top diplomat Wang Yi on Friday, sources say (Reuters). The Chinese are hoping this will pave the way to higher level talks .... Wangâ€™s trip to US â€˜crucialâ€™, to pave the way for higher-level of interactions (Global Times). As to what is my take .... I am skeptical.Â There is little common ground between the two governments. They differ on Taiwan, trade, the Israel - Hamas war, the Russia - Ukraine war, the South China Sea, and more importantly, they do not trust each other. Sighhh ..... but talking is better than not talking.

entry.title: Heavy rains cause partial dam collapse, flooding in Norway

Flooding of the Braskereidfoss power dam control room prevented the hatches from opening, causing a partial collapse and flooding downriver. The heavy rains provoked mudslides and swollen rivers which swept away some structures and flooded towns, requiring the evacuation of more than 3,000 people and isolating others.

entry.title: Who is responsible for Turkeyâ€™s bad buildings?
entry.summary:
Buildings destroyed after the earthquake on February 13, 2023, in Hatay, Turkey. | Murat Saka/dia images via Getty Images
Turkey is investigating and has arrested some contractors, but the entire political and economic system is implicated. Turkey is still in the middle of an emergency, reeling from the earthquake that killed at least 35,000 people last week. But the finger-pointing has already begun. The rush to punishment comes amid the grief, but also the mounting fury and frustration over the Turkish governmentâ€™s earthquake response. Much of that is focused on the emergency response â€” waiting for aid and rescue teams â€” but it is also extending to anger about policies before the earthquake, about how shoddy building construction may have exacerbated the devastation of the disâ€¦

entry.title: 10 years ago, we were turning nuclear bombs into nuclear energy. We can do it again.
entry.summary:
Getty Images
How we turned 20,000 Soviet nukes into zero-carbon energy â€” and how we can do the same with some of our own. Just a decade ago, one in 10 American lightbulbs was powered by dismantled Russian nuclear weapons. That was made possible by the Megatons to Megawatts program, an agreement negotiated after the collapse of the Soviet Union to convert uranium from Russiaâ€™s nuclear weapons stockpile into fuel for US nuclear power plants. The unconventional policy was first proposed by MIT physicist Thomas Neff in a 1991 New York Times op-ed. By the time Megatons to Megawatts ran its full course from 1993 to 2013, it had eliminated about 20,000 nuclear warheads and stood out as a point of shared pride in the often jaded arms control and disarmament field. â€œNearly every commerciaâ€¦

entry.title: Why earthquakes are deadlier depending on where you live
entry.summary:
Volunteers stand on rubble of a destroyed building in Kahramanmaras, Turkey, on February 7, 2023. | Adem Altan/AFP via Getty Images
What Turkey and Syriaâ€™s deadly earthquakes reveal about wealth. In the early hours of Monday, February 6, residents living in southern Turkey and northern Syria were woken by violent shaking, collapsing buildings, and sweeping blackouts. The earthquake buried residents in rubble and was followed by powerful aftershocks. By the following Monday, the death toll had passed 36,000 people. â€œIt was like the apocalypse,â€ Abdul Salam al-Mahmoud, a resident of Atareb, Syria, told Reuters. The country is no stranger to quakes, having lost 17,000 people to a 7.4-magnitude tremor in 1999. But while last weekâ€™s earthquake was a 7.8-magnitude quake, and had an uâ€¦

A suspected Chinese spy balloon flies above Charlotte, North Carolina, on February 4, 2023.Â | Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images
As all these objects fall, a new space race is rising. Now that the US military has shot down a suspected spy balloon from China and three other unidentified flying objects, there will be debates about the UFOsâ€™ meaning, their capabilities, and why they were all up there in the first place. Though former CIA Director Michael Hayden said the initial balloonâ€™s threat to the welfare of Americans was vastly inflated, others described the incident as a wake-up call. Former Trump national security adviser H.R. McMaster hopes it will lead to a â€œSputnik moment,â€ harkening back to the US space race with the Soviet Union. The Wall Street Journal even warâ€¦
